employees.notes: Proff lists 160 employees for Protan AS.[1]

revenue.notes: Proff reports operating revenue as 888 053 with amounts stated in thousands NOK; converted to NOK 888,053,000.[1]

company.entity_resolution_notes: The Norwegian legal entity is identified as PROTAN AS with org. no. 983599060 on Proff, and the same organization number appears in a Protan AS EPD document.[1][4]

srm_assessment.overall_summary: Protan reports inbound use of recycled surplus material in roofing products, with a stated 4.5-6.5% recycled share in 2023 and procedures across production facilities.[2][3]

srm_inputs.label: Recycled PVC-based surplus material
material_examples: recycled surplus material in roofing products
srm_inputs.used_for: Returned cuttings and surplus material are regenerated and reused as input in new roofing products at Protan factories.[2]
srm_inputs.tier_reasoning: Evidence indicates routine reuse across production facilities and a quantified recycled share (4.5-6.5%) in roofing products, suggesting meaningful but not dominant input share.[2][3]

share.context: Source states a range of 4.5-6.5% recycled surplus material; 5.5% is a midpoint estimate for aggregation.[2]

srm_inputs.volume_notes: No direct mass/volume/energy quantity of inbound recycled material is disclosed; only a percentage range is provided.[2]
srm_inputs.uncertainties: The percentage is presented as a range and may vary by product and production site; company-specific tonnage for Protan AS is not disclosed.[2][3]

gaps_and_uncertainties: Public sources reviewed do not provide Protan AS-specific annual tonnage of recycled input material, only percentage-based statements.[2][3]
Some disclosures are phrased at Protan/production-facility level, so exact allocation to the single legal entity Protan AS is uncertain.[2][3]

evidence.evidence_snippet: Juridisk navn PROTAN AS Org nr 983 599 060
evidence.claim: Legal name and organization number for the company.

evidence.evidence_snippet: NACE-bransje 22.240 Produksjon av byggevarer av plast 22.250 Bearbeiding og etterbehandling av plastprodukter

evidence.claim: Revenue figures are denominated in NOK thousands.

evidence.evidence_snippet: The returned material is regenerated and reused in new products at our factory.
evidence.location_hint: Section: What happens to the returned cuttings and surplus material?
evidence.claim: Returned surplus material is used as inbound input in new products.

evidence.evidence_snippet: In 2023, our roofing products consisted of 4.5-6.5% recycled surplus material
evidence.location_hint: Section: What happens to the returned cuttings and surplus material?
evidence.claim: Quantified recycled-content share in roofing products.

evidence.evidence_snippet: Protan has established procedures across all its production facilities to recycle surplus materials into new products.
evidence.location_hint: Section: What happens to the returned cuttings and surplus material?
evidence.claim: Recycling into new products is implemented across production facilities.

evidence.evidence_snippet: Protan has implemented routines in all our production facilities where all surplus materials are recycled into new products.
evidence.claim: Corroborates facility-wide recycling of surplus materials into products.

evidence.evidence_snippet: Owner of the declaration: Protan AS
evidence.claim: EPD owner confirms company identity as Protan AS.
EPD lists the organization number matching Protan AS.
